headline.main: Commissioners of Emigestion--Letter from Secretary Marey.
A VISIT TO KOSSUTH.; Personal Incidents, Conversation, Exiles in England, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Independent. It is a hard thing to be a refugee in London. A stranger with small means, who has failed in some of the miscrable efforts of "those foreigners" for liberty, is not respectable. headline.main: NEW-JERSEY.; Ravages of the Choleru in Jersey City. Jersey City Water Celebratoin.

ONE DAY LATER FROM EUROPE.; FLIGHT OF CHRISTINA FROM SPAIN. Steady Cotton Market-Consols 95 1-8. Fine Harvests. The Full News of Four Days. VISIT OF PRINCE ALBERT TO NAPOLEON ARRIVAL OF THE ATLANTIC. REFUSAL OF PEACE TERMS BY RUSSIA.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamer Atlantic, from Liverpool Wednesday forenoon, Sept. 6, with 213 passengers, arrived at this port Tuesday Morning, Sept. 19, at 7 1/2 A. M. The Cunard Mail steamer Arabia arrived at Liverpool at 7 o'clock on the evening of Saturday, Sept. 2.

headline.main: LATER FROM TEXAS.; Indian Movements--The Crops, & c.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have Galveston papers to the 8th inst., and a large number of exchanges from other towns in Texas. The Austin State Gazelle, of the 2d inst., has the following paragraphs : In the course of the last two weeks considerable activity has prevailed in the Quartermaster's Department at San Antonio.

docs.lead_paragraph: A GLOOMY SABBATH.--Yesterday was, perhaps, the gloomiest Sunday that most persons in our community have ever spent. The churches were opened, but their congregations were exceedingly thin, and an aspect of anxiety and dejection was visible on every face. The exercises were brief, but solemn and impressive.

headline.main: FROM HAVANA.; Arrival of the Cahnwba-Intelligence of the Slave Trade, &c..

docs.lead_paragraph: In relation to the Slave Trade between Cuba and the coast of Africa there does not seem to be any cessation--on the contrary, more vigilance on the part of the speculaters--more energy, and consequently more success. The last few days have brought us several not well defined reports of landings made at various points on the South side, of which two or three were near to the grand mart of the traffic, Trinidad.

headline.main: RELIGIOUS MOVEMENTS.; The American Board of Commissioners for Foreign Missions. SECOND DAY--Co TINUED.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Session of the Board last evening was one of the most excited and stormy passages which this good old Society has ever gone through. It is usual to devote Thursday evening to miscellaneous addresses from returned missionaries, accompanied with devotional exercises. The excited interest felt respecting the disposition to be made of the report and resolutions on Slavery, induced the Board to continue its business sittings through the evening. docs.lead_paragraph: Mortality in Brooklyn. The Health Officer reports 128 deaths as having occurred during the week ending Saturday last, from the following diseases. Apoplexy, Atrophy, Wound, Carhoncle, Congestion of the brain, do lungs, Congestive fever, Typhus fever, Hemorrhage of the lungs, Inflammation of the howels, do. liver, Intemperance, Malformation, Ulcers in the throat--I each; Bronchitis.
